headline: Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
subhead: Two days ahead of a meeting of European Union heads of state and government in Brussels, the president called on the 27 member states, in an interview with Le Monde and several other European newspapers, to make joint investments in protecting the environment, as well as in artificial intelligence and quantum technology, to avoid falling behind.

headline: Israel's retention of Palestinian bodies: A silent 'hostage-taking'
Epstein accomplice Maxwell refuses to answer questions from US House panel
France's municipal elections at risk of foreign interference
subhead: Structurally less attractive to foreign spies than legislative elections, municipal elections are not immune to deception, most of which tends to be local.

headline: Cuba says airlines can no longer refuel on the island as US blockade deepens energy crisis
subhead: In the latest step to ration energy, Cuba announced that there is not enough jet fuel for planes to refuel on the island – notably affecting long-haul routes and thus the tourism economy. Though US sanctions against Cuba have been in place for more than 60 years, they have reached new extremes since the US military operation that deposed Nicolas Maduro.

headline: Meet New York's 'bodega boys,' the Yemeni shopkeepers caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
subhead: The Trump administration imposed a new entry ban in June 2025 targeting 12 countries, including Yemen. The move has put at risk a community deeply rooted in the local economy: the 'bodega boys,' mostly Yemeni shopkeepers who run corner grocery stores throughout New York.

headline: Rugby legend Serge Blanco launches bid to become Biarritz mayor
subhead: The former Biarritz fullback is running in the March municipal elections, without any party affiliation. He is facing six other candidates in a race where rugby is never far from people's minds.

headline: Iran: Videos show live ammunition used in crackdown
Victor Pereira, historian: 'It is clear that far-right ideas have become normalized in Portugal'
Trump threatens to stop opening of Canada-US bridge
Jury told that Meta, Google 'engineered addiction' at landmark US trial
Discord turns to facial recognition in child safety crackdown
Japan's Sanae Takaichi emboldened by landslide victory in snap elections
Jean-Luc Mélenchon fumes after party is labeled 'far-left' by government
Lebanon condemns Israeli glyphosate attack in country's south
Macron says Epstein scandal 'mainly concerns' US
Is Macron's attack on video games targeting the wrong enemy?
Is it ever a good idea to... wear UGGs?
Norway launches probe of diplomat and husband over Epstein links
2026 Olympics: 'In Russia, even an amateur athlete can become an agent of influence'
subhead: The Milan-Cortina Olympic Games mark a new stage in the reintegration of Russian athletes into international competitions. The momentum has been fueled by Moscow's efforts to use sports as an instrument of power, explains researcher Lukas Aubin in an interview with Le Monde.

headline: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

headline: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

headline: The challenge of action for France's fragile and constrained government
'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
